spirit:field.spirit:name: boot_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Boot Select 0 : Program Mode 1 : Boot from Flash 2 : Boot from I2C Slave 3 : Boot from IRAM

spirit:field.spirit:name: version_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Version select - Use this for modules that have more than one version

spirit:field.spirit:name: module_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Module select - To read a version of a particular module, set this field to the index of the module in the feature register - If a module has more than one version, use the version_sel field to select the one of interest - Once the right module is selected and where applicable the right version within the module, issue a read of the module_version register to obtain the version of interest - Note that a module must be present to be able to read its version - Note that some modules do not have a register interface and as a result do not have a version

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Pending register - This indicates which events are pending, Write 1 to clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: mca_rx_cpu_srdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active-High MCA RX CPU SRDY

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which pending events are enabled to cause an interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: mca_rx_cpu_srdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active-High MCA RX CPU SRDY

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the registered state of interrupt signals

spirit:field.spirit:name: rs232_underrun_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the RS-232 Underrun Error (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: mca_rx_cpu_srdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the MCA RX CPU SRDY (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: eop
spirit:field.spirit:description: End-Of-Packet (Active-High) Indicates whether this is the last byte of a packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start-Of-Packet (Active-High) Indicates whether this is the first byte of a packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to write into the communication channel

spirit:field.spirit:name: eop
spirit:field.spirit:description: End-Of-Packet (Active-High) Indicates whether this is the last byte of a packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start-Of-Packet (Active-High) Indicates whether this is the first byte of a packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte read from the communication channel

spirit:field.spirit:name: ipg_m1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Inter Packet Gap - 1 (minimum number of clock cycles between packets, e.g to guarantee 12 set this to 11)

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: XMII Mode: 0 : GMII 1 : MII 2 : RGMII 3 : RMII

spirit:field.spirit:name: clk_down_scale
spirit:field.spirit:description: Module Clock Down Scaling Factor Scale the module clock to a minimum of 16x the baud rate: floor(<freq>/(16x<baud rate>))

spirit:field.spirit:name: num_xgmii_clks
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of XGMII clocks to do the XGMII idle count

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to initiate a XGMII idle count. HW will clear this field upon completion. Once cleared the number of idles can be obtained.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clei_tx
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0 : PTP to GMII 1 : PTP to CLEI

spirit:field.spirit:name: clei_rx
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0 : GMII to PTP 1 : CLEI to PTP (with flow control)

variant.name: none
variant.doc: 'none' variant states including all templates which are not assigned any variant property.
